content:
• Monday, July 7, 2014
  • APPCQ

    Standard General confirms talks with American Apparel, warns of proxy fight

    • American Apparel (APP) +5.1% AH after Standard General confirms in an SEC filing that it is in talks with the retailer to shore up the company's finances, reconstitute its board and strengthen its management.
    • If the talks break down, the hedge fund says it could launch a proxy fight to win board seats.
    • APP is under pressure to repay a $10M loan from Lion Capital, another investment firm, and Standard General's talks with APP are said to be aimed in part at hammering out a financing agreement that would allow the company to pay off the loan.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • BLUE

    Bluebird -3% AH on $100M offering

    • Bluebird bio (NASDAQ:BLUE) plans to sell $100M worth of shares through a public offering. Underwriters will have a $15M overallotment option.
    • The gene therapy developer had $192.5M in cash as of March 31, and no debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

     
    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TXMD +21.1%. NES +9.6%. AMPE +3.9%. MIC +3.8%. CNAT +3.3%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MOSY -2.6%. KEYW -2.0%. DKS -2.0%. ZAGG -2.0%. TGA -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • MIC

    Macquarie Infrastructure to acquire remainder of IMTT for $1.025B

    • Macquarie Infrastructure (NYSE:MIC) +3.8% AH after agreeing to acquire the 50% stake in International-Matex Tank Terminals it does not already own for $1.025B in cash and stock.
    • MIC expects the acquisition to be accretive to free cash flow per share in 2014, and sees underlying 2014 free cash flow of ~$4.55/share, or 11.2% higher than in 2013; MIC also introduces guidance for 2015 underlying free cash flow of $5.10/share.
    • To fund the deal, MIC announces separate public offerings of 10M shares and $250M of convertible senior notes due July 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • CHK

    Natural gas at six-month lows on cooler weather outlook, Chesapeake -4.7%

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.7%) suffers sharp losses as natural gas prices tumble to their lowest in nearly six months after weather forecasts over the weekend showed lower than expected temperatures ahead.
    • Cooling patterns expected to hit the U.S. midwest and northeast over the next 6-10 days have investors betting utilities won't need to burn as much natural gas in the weeks ahead, as summer demand for electricity to run air conditioners eases.
    • The absence of extreme heat has helped chip away at a record natural gas shortage following last year's unusually severe winter; last week, the EIA reported an eighth consecutive week of producers adding more than 100B cu. ft. of natural gas to storage.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ-OLD, FCG, GASL, KOLD, UNL, GASX, NAGS, DCNG
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 7 Comments
  • TWER

    Towerstream -7.9% on Canaccord downgrade

    • Canaccord has downgraded Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) to Speculative Buy from Buy.
    • Shares now -41% YTD, thanks in part to liquidity concerns. The wireless broadband service/infrastructure provider ended Q1 with $21.2M in cash/equivalents, down from $28.2M at the end of Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • WNR

    Western Refining +2% as Citi upgrades, sees restructuring potential

    • Western Refining (WNR +1.9%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $55 price target, raised from $43, at Citigroup, which sees a potential restructuring helping to unlock shareholder value.
    • Citi believes WNR could restructure into a holding company with the limited and general partnership interests in Northern Tier Energy (NTI -0.9%) and Western Refining Logistics (WNRL -1.4%), which would allow WNR to generate a ~10% free cash flow yield over its forecast period.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • BB

    10-month highs for BlackBerry amid short-covering, healthcare news

    • BlackBerry (BBRY +6.4%) is at levels last seen prior to its giant Sep. 2013 warning. With 1/5 of the float shorted as of June 13, short-covering is undoubtedly a factor.
    • Also possibly helping: A report from the Economic Times stating BlackBerrry plans to launch a healthcare service that will rely on data from thousands of medical devices to "enable early detection of illnesses." A BlackBerry exec says the company is "running trials with multiple hospitals in India."
    • The service is being launched in partnership with NantHealth, developer of a clinical software platform used by ~250 hospitals and connected to 16K+ medical devices. BlackBerry disclosed a stake in NantHealth in April, along with plans to offer a healthcare-optimized smartphone (among other things).
    • Citron Research recently talked up BlackBerry's efforts to provide an OS (QNX) and analytics infrastructure (Project Ion) for companies looking to obtain insights from the data produced by embedded devices.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 17 Comments
  • TSLA

    Analysis: Soft sales reads on Tesla increase importance of China

    • Though there's plenty of headlines about a high-profile crash of a Tesla Model S today, the real story might be over at Barclays Capital.
    • Notable Calls tips that Barclays sees Tesla Q2 deliveries falling below expectations.
    • The soft reads in a couple of different markets for the EV automaker has increased the importance of China, notes Barclays.
    • Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA -3.7%) are at their session lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 57 Comments
  • URS

    URS heading for seventh straight up day, analyst cites M&A speculation

    • URS (URS +2.5%) continues its strong move higher on a surge in volume, climbing 16.5% since June 26 despite no significant news.
    • Stephens analyst Will Gabrielski thinks the recent uptick probably is due to speculation of potential M&A activity; he notes that a URS takeout could potentially be in the $55-$90/share range.
    • The firm reiterates its Overweight rating and $54 price target, and shares have jumped another ~2.5% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • SEAS

    SeaWorld starts to get its sea legs back

    • Shares of SeaWorld (SEAS +1.5%) move higher on the back of an upgrade from Longbow Research to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • What to watch: Weather patterns have been favorable for theme park operators for the early part of the summer season, although for SeaWorld there is still the question of how promotional the company had to turn to drive traffic. There's been some debate on if the company is still feeling an impact from the Blackfish documentary which tarnished the brand a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • LEU

    Bankruptcy court says USEC can seek creditor vote on reorganization plan

    • USEC (USU -22.1%) wins bankruptcy court approval to seek creditor votes on a plan to hand control to noteholders that would swap convertible notes and all of USEC’s preferred and common shares for ~$240M in new debt and new common stock.
    • Noteholders would receive $200M of the new debt and 79 % of the new equity, with preferred shareholders Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF) and Babcock & Wilcox (BWC) each receiving ~$20M of the new debt and ~8% of the new stock; existing shareholders would get just 5% of USEC’s new shares under the plan.
    • Shares rallied strongly last week on receiving $2.5M in new funding from the Energy Department, but the market has corrected today and last Thursday after the apparent overreaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • TTPH

    Down day for Tetraphase Pharma

    • Demonstrating an annoying problem of holding a thinly-traded stock, shares of nano cap Tetraphase Pharmaceuticals (TTPH -13.9%) plummet on a 2x surge in volume, albeit only 354K shares, on no news.
    • On June 19, the company announced the completion of enrollment of its Phase 3 clinical trial for its lead product candidate eravacycline as a treatment for complicated urinary tract infections.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • TPR

    Is the worst over at Coach?

    • Shares of Coach (COH +1.7%) inch back over the $36 level for the first time in a few weeks as the stock shows signs of bottoming-out from its dismal 36% YTD decline.
    • SA contributor Bret Jensen is betting on a Coach turnaround and using the +3.7% dividend yield as a backstop. The retailer has plenty of net cash and no net debt, which should help support share price.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 7 Comments
  • TDW

    Tidewater -4.7% on Morgan Stanley downgrade

    • Tidewater (TDW -4.7%) is downgraded to Underweight from Overweight with a $50 price target, down from $59, at Morgan Stanley amid notions that demand for the global OSV fleet in 2015 will be in the low single-digits while supply growth will be in the mid-teens.
    • Based on beliefs that TDW will face near-term headwinds, the firm cuts its utilization assumption for towing supply vessels and other non-deepwater vessels by 5%, resulting in TDW EPS estimates for FY 2015 and 2016 that are "meaningfully" below respective $3.98 and $3.61 consensus.
    • Although Morgan believes TDW is more vulnerable to a near-term slump, the firm is more optimistic long-term, seeing significant upside into a probable 2016-17 recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • GTATQ

    UBS joins Canaccord in downgrading GT; Rubicon also hit

    • "We believe GT can still hit the midpoint of its sales guidance of $600-$800M but believe our checks of a slower ramp in 2Q14 makes the high end more challenging," writes UBS' Stephen Chin while downgrading GT Advanced (GTAT -13%) to Neutral.
    • Chin is worried about the pace at which Apple-related sapphire output is growing, and has respectively cut his 2014 revenue and EPS forecasts by $100M and $0.05 to $700M and $0.12. Consensus is at $696.5M (+133% Y/Y) and $0.08.
    • Canaccord's Jonathan Dosheimer, who this morning cut GT to Hold, expresses skepticism the iPhone 6 will use sapphire cover glass in large volumes, and considers 2016 EPS upside unlikely unless sapphire cover glass is used across Apple's iPhone/iWatch lineups.
    • Dorsheimer's remarks follows a June report claiming only the 5.5" iPhone 6 will feature sapphire cover glass - the 4.7" model will use Gorilla Glass - and that the 5.5" model will be in short supply through year's end due to sapphire yield issues.
    • Sapphire wafer vendor Rubicon (RBCN -5.9%) is following GT lower on a weak day for tech. GT is still up 95% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 13 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: CAMT +38%. EVRY +24%. CNIT-OLD +20%. GENE +20%. BDSI +11%. GRH +10%. CTP +10%. PENX +10%. ONE +9%. UBIC +9%.
    • Top 10 Losers: USU -20%. RNA -16%. CBAK-OLD -16%. DRL -14%. SMSI -14%. GTAT -13%. VTL -12%. TTPH -12%. KONE -12%. OCRX -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • RNA

    Prosensa files mixed shelf offering

    • Shares of Prosensa Holding N.V. (RNA -15.6%) take a dive on modest volume in response to its Thursday afternoon regulatory filing for a $150M mixed shelf offering and the registration for sale of 18.9M shares by certain institutional shareholders.
    • F-3
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy downgrade at Deutsche Bank sinks coal stocks

    • Coal stocks suffer a beating after Deutsche Bank downgrades Peabody Energy (BTU -3.3%) to Hold from Buy with a $19 price target, down from $23, to reflect lower realized coal prices (particularly metallurgical coal) and anticipated ongoing cost pressures in foreseeable future.
    • Consol Energy (CNX -1.7%) is the firm’s only Buy-rated coal stock because of the company’s “fast-growing natural gas business and solid financial position.”
    • Although the Deutsche team says its focus is shifting to more company specific stories from an emphasis on sector performance, other coal companies are sharply lower: ACI -4.3%, ANR -4.8%, YZC -1.3%, CLD -2.4%, WLT -3.6%, RNO -1.5%, WLB -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 7 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena chief's stock sale invites criticism

    • The legitimacy of any rosy pronouncements about Belviq's prospects by Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -8.4%) CEO Jack Lief has been tarnished a bit with the disclosure of his disposal of a large portion of his holdings of ARNA stock. Mr. Lief felt compelled to unload almost 40% of his stake. Such a large transaction undermines the credibility of "asset diversification" and can only be construed as bearish behavior by the most significant company insider.
    • The ramp-up of Belviq sales has been underwhelming to most observers. Last quarter's sales were a modest $2.9M compared to Q2 2013's debut of $1.3M.
    • ARNA's stock is down 60% from its late June 2012 peak of $13.50. 208 mutual funds have positions, down from 210 a year earlier.
    • Consensus views remain bullish, however. Revenue estimates for Q2 and Q3 are $9.8M and $12.1M, respectively. Estimates for 2014 and 2015 are $43.8M and $85.7M, respectively.
    • The company should report Q2 results in mid-to-late August.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 10 Comments
  • LSG

    Lake Shore Gold +12% on record Q2, H1 output

    • Lake Shore Gold (LSG +12%) surges after reporting record Q2 production, recording a 70% Y/Y rise in gold production, and H1 2014 output of 96,900 oz., a 79% Y/Y increase.
    • LSG, which owns three multimillion-ounce gold complexes in the Timmins gold camp in northern Ontario, produced 52,300 oz. of gold, placing it on track to achieve the top end of its production guidance of 160K-180K oz. of gold this year.
    • LSG said it had poured and sold some 53,500 oz. of gold during the quarter at an average selling price of $1,289/oz., vs. 27,600 oz. sold in the year-ago quarter at an average price of $1,409/oz.
    • Lake Shore’s Toronto-listed stock rose to a new 52-week high on Friday on the report, which was issued after Thursday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • LQMT

    Liquidmetal higher after Apple patent application receives ink

    • A recent patent application (noticed last Thursday by AppleInsider) assigned to both Apple and Liquidmetal (OTCQB:LQMT +7.6%) covers the use of a "counter-gravity casting process" with a molten metal alloy.
    • Apple argues counter-gravity (vacuum-based) casting enables higher yields and simplified molding relative to a poured casting approach. The company has filed a number of Liquidmetal-related patent applications in recent years.
    • In May, Liquidmetal extended a patent exclusivity deal with Apple that covers consumer electronics products by a year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 9 Comments
  • FUEL

    Rocket Fuel -10.3% following Wells Fargo launch

    • Wells Fargo has launched coverage on Rocket Fuel (NASDAQ:FUEL) with a Market Perform and $31-$33 valuation range. Shares have plunged on a down day for tech.
    • Rocket Fuel soared two weeks ago after launching a targeted ad solution that leverages data from Nielsen/comScore. Its shares are no stranger to stomach-churning volatility.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • DAL

    Airline stocks lose altitude on renewed concerns

    • Another tough day for airline stocks as worries in the sector over business demand and capacity continue to crop up.
    • Delta roiled the sector last week with a cautious view on second-half profit.
    • The World Cup has put a bigger crimp in business travel to Latin America than expected, according to analysts.
    • Also in the news, both Delta and American Airlines say they will cut flights to Venezuela due to a dispute over cash trapped in the nation.
    • Decliners: Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) -3.0%, Republic Airways (RJET) -2.9%, American Airlines Group (NASDAQ:AAL) -2.5%, United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) -2.0%, Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum completes Tuscaloosa Marine Shale well

    • In an operational update of its Tuscaloosa Marine Shale results, Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -6.4%) says it completed its Beech Grove 94H-1 well in Louisiana, with a peak 24-hour production rate of ~740 boe/day.
    • GDP says it also began completion operations on its SLC 81H-1 well in Louisiana, and its Denkmann 33-28H-2 and Bates 25-24H-1 wells in Mississippi.
    • Says it is currently running three rigs in the Tuscalosa with plans to go to as many as five rigs by year-end; GDP owns 300K-plus net acres in the play.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • RDN

    Radian investors mull Puerto Rico exposure

    • MBIA and Assured Guaranty have had a tough go of it since Puerto Rico moved closer to a debt restructuring over the past couple of weeks, but also exposed and also stumbling a bit is Radian Group (RDN -2%) whose Radian Asset Assurance has $452M in net PR exposure, according to Moody's.
    • As a percent of qualified statutory capital, though, Radian's 31% isn't close to MBIA's 145%. Exposure to the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority - which made its July debt payment, but is expected to seek protection at some point - for Radian is just 2% of qualified statutory exposure vs. 46% for MBIA.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • UMBF

    One bank boosted, another cut at Raymond James

    • A possible pairs trade from Raymond James has the firm downgrading UMB Financial (UMBF -1.5%) to Underperform on valuation, while upgrading Associated Banc-Corp (ASBC +0.5%) to Market Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty still a Buy at UBS

    • Cutting its price target on Assured Guaranty (AGO -1.2%) to $28 from $31 following Puerto Rico's move to pave the way for debt restructuring, UBS says the 10% decline in the AGO stock since is overdone.
    • Assured has about $2.6B in exposure to debt covered by PR's Recovery Act, says UBS, and still has the necessary excess capital and liquidity to carry through on its stock buyback plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • RGC

    Weak box office numbers whack exhibitor stocks

    • Movie theater stocks Regal Entertainment (RGC -1.1%), Carmike Cinemas (CKEC -0.6%), and Cinemark Holdings (CNK -3%) trade lower after a weak 4th of July weekend keeps movie chains under pressure to meet Q3 projections.
    • IMAX (IMAX -0.6%) and RealD (RLD -2.9%) are also lower off the lackluster box office news.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • GENE

    Genetic Technologies up in early trading

    • Shares of thinly-traded nano cap Genetic Technologies (GENE +19.1%) jump on an 8x surge in volume (833K shares) in response to its announcement of robust growth in BREVAGen sample volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • CSIQ

    Tech ratings changes: CSIQ, KING, UTEK, SONS, BV, MOBL

    • Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4%) has been upgraded to Outperform by FBR. The firm cites the strength of CSIQ's project pipeline.
    • King Digital (KING +5.5%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Piper. The firm expects Q2 results to meet estimates, and for games not titled Candy Crush Saga (previous) to drive diversification in 2H14.
    • Ultratech (UTEK +4.1%) has been upgraded to Buy by BofA/Merrill.
    • iGate (IGTE +0.5%) has been upgraded to Buy by Noble Financial.
    • CDW (CDW -3.1%) has been cut to Market Perform by Raymond James.
    • Sonus (SONS +3%) has been started at Outperform by Pac Crest.
    • Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +0.2%) has been started at Buy by B. Riley.
    • MobileIron (MOBL +8.4%) has received 7 bullish ratings from IPO underwriters, and no neutral or bearish ones.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion +3.8% on Q2 guidance hike

    • Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) now expects Q2 revenue to be up 30%-32% Q/Q, well above prior guidance for 10%-15% growth. The consensus is for revenue to grow 11.7% Q/Q to $59M.
    • Q2 gross margin guidance has been hiked to 51%-52% from 48%-50%. SIMO previously also guided for a full-year GM of 48%-50%.
    • Healthy industry-wide NAND flash demand likely gave a lift to SIMO's NAND controller sales.
    • Shares have made new 52-week highs. Full Q2 results are due on July 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting +13.5% on guidance update

    • Revolution Lighting (NASDAQ:RVLT) expects Q2 revenue of $17.5M, up from $5M in Q1 and $7.5M a year ago. The Q2 figure includes two months of sales from recently-acquired Value Lighting, which has been forecast to have 2014 sales of $55M.
    • Revolution's Q3 revenue is expected to to total $24M-$26M, and 2H revenue $55M-$60M.
    • The company previously guided for pro forma 2014 revenue (adjusts for acquisitions) of $110M. Full Q2 results will be issued in early August.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: EVRY +19%. BDSI +14%. OTC:IGC +11%. RVLT +11%. SIMO +8%. MOBL +8%. CAMT +8%. GENE +7%. KNDI +7%. KING +7%. MNGA +5%.
    • Losers: CBAK-OLD -10%. GTAT -10%. SBGL -6%. USU -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • KNDI

    Kandi +7.1% after receiving $31.8M in subsidies

    • The Chinese government has provided Kandi's (NASDAQ:KNDI) 50%-owned Kandi Electric Vehicles JV with RMB197M ($31.8M) in subsidies for selling over 4K EVs from June 2013 through Q1 2014.
    • Kandi adds the the city of Hangzhou, where the company has launched EV rental and leasing programs, is "expected to announce its local subsidy policy for new energy vehicles in the near future."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • PALDF

    N. American Palladium says senior secured term loan interest rate reduced

    • North American Palladium (PAL) +9.3% premarket after saying it has returned to a reduced interest rate on its senior secured term loan and its operating credit facility has been extended.
    • PAL says it made a $23.4M payment to its senior secured term loan lender; in consideration of the payment and the capitalization of the remaining $16.2M of accrued and unpaid interest, PAL will revert to quarterly cash payments at a 15% interest rate with the first such cash interest payment on Sept. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 6 Comments
  • RLGY

    Realogy higher after Barron's mention

    • The stock is a cheap bet on the housing recovery, writes Barron's Leslie Norton of Realogy (NYSE:RLGY), which has slid 23% YTD alongside concerns about a slump in real estate. Hit particularly hard was the company's mortgage unit after refinancing ground to a halt.
    • Still, Realogy continues to generate plenty of cash  - $734,.2M expected this year, and maybe $900M in 2015 - which management has pledged to use to pay down a heavy debt load now standing at $3.9B. The paper currently carries a junk rating, but if management's debt cut goals are reached at the end of next year, a re-rating to investment grade would pave the way for dividends and/or buybacks.
    • Shares +2.7% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • ENDP

    Positive top-line results for BEMA buprenorphine Phase 3

    • Endo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ENDP) and BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) announce that the Phase 3 clinical trial of BEMA buprenorphine as a treatment for severe pain achieved its primary efficacy endpoint of a statistically significant improvement in chronic pain relief versus placebo in patients with pain severe enough to require daily, 24-hour, long-term opioid treatment for which alternative treatment options are inadequate.
    • Under the terms of their licensing agreement, the locking of the database for the opioid-experienced study triggers a $10M milestone payment from ENDP to BDSI.
    • Endo has a pre-NDA meeting scheduled with the FDA this month and intends to complete its regulatory submission as soon as possible.
    • BDSI shares are up 15% premarket on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • NGD

    New Gold: New Afton C-zone gold measured and indicated resources +24%

    • New Gold (NYSEMKT:NGD) +2.5% premarket after a mid-year update of its New Afton C-zone mineral resource reveals measured and indicated contained gold resource has increased by 24% and the contained copper resource by 29% when compared to year-end 2013.
    • NGD says the C-zone measured and indicated gold and copper grades compare favorably to the B-zone measured and indicated grades of 0.65 grams/metric ton gold and 0.91% copper.
    • The C-zone is a continuation of the New Afton block cave that extends along strike and below the B-zone reserve that is currently being mined.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBBY

    New buyback plan for Bed Bath & Beyond

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) approves a new $2B share repurchase program on top of a plan which still has $861M remaining.
    • The company expects the new buyback plan to be completed during FY16.
    • BBBY +0.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • BBBY

    Analysis: Online threats to clip Bed Bath & Beyond

    • Bank of America downgrades Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) to an Underperform rating from Neutral.
    • Online competition could chip away at the retailer's market share, warns BofA.
    • The investment firm drops its price target on the stock to $51.
    • BBBY -1.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors to investigate split-in-two Model S

    • Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) are mildly lower as a story of a fiery crash of a stolen Model S in L.A. grabs some headlines.
    • After a high-speed chase, the Model S is reported to have split in two after impacting with a light pole.
    • The automaker says it will investigate the accident.
    • TSLA -0.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 56 Comments
  • GTATQ

    Canaccord downgrades GT Advanced

    • GT Advanced (GTAT) has been downgraded by Canaccord Genuity to a Hold rating from Buy. The target price for the stock is $20.
    • Last week, the company announced its new restructuring, eliminating approximately 70 jobs and recording $13.4M in charges ($1.8M cash).
    • GTAT -6.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM
  • JMI

    Javelin lower after downgrade at Citi

    • Javelin Mortgage (NYSE:JMI) is lower by 0.7% premarket after Citigroup.s Donald Fandetti cuts to Sell, noting higher interest creates will be a headwind for the company. Why pick on Javelin? The stock trades at a premium to book value, says Fandetti, vs. most of its peers selling for discounts.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
